document.title: Indiana Department of Education Academic Standards Content Framework

CCF83A9425364B1BA8BAE30B94B94AD1.description:
Develop an individual SAE program and implementation plan for record keeping
skills.

6A63A0D71D7B4C5C8195F14DA3B77623.description:
Explore the numerous possibilities for an SAE program which a student might
develop.

BD5E420DC3D84E06B2BEE0CBA4DB147C.description:
Explain the nature of and become familiar with those terms related to an SAE
program.

CAF58BE38A13469583DE27C5AB285BB4.description:
Students validate the necessity of a Supervised Agricultural Experience (SAE)
program as a critical component to a well-rounded agricultural education.

23A3A6E5C9C74F0D8650E6D6082D2B94.description: Develop a skill set to enhance the positive evolution of the whole person.

41C21BEC21574A44B0803B4B67A4F02E.description: Acquire the skills necessary to positively influence others.

F4909DAA90C44D52AC64CBAA1F24D3A1.description: Examine roles within teams, work units, departments, organizations, interorganizational systems, and the larger environment.

AD126A95F06D49F892825412B60A09B2.description:
Recognize and explain the role of the FFA in the development of leadership,
education, employability, communications and human relations skills.

1F91CF86C56F4846B8FD3E55F0E25D5E.description:
Communicate clearly, effectively, and with reason through speaking, writing,
visuals, and active listening in formal and informal settings.

6549B304869D452B830F05698E77B06A.description:
Students validate the necessity of leadership skills development in conjunction
with participation in The National FFA Organization (FFA) as a critical component to a well-rounded
agricultural education.

44F97A7079D845B78DFCF535AEA10535.description:
Demonstrate those qualities, attributes and skills necessary to succeed in, or
further prepare for, a chosen career while effectively contributing to society.

2CCE587D66284594A2E479FAEE80CAD9.description:
Identify how key organizational structures and processes affect organizational
performance and the quality of products and services.

CA0D0571E08643D39C880E60779437D2.description:
Describe career opportunities and means to achieve those opportunities in
animal sciences.

7F3A4077EB894D2E8874DE388299896D.description:
Evaluate the nature and scope of animal sciences in agriculture, society, and
the economy.

03F1AE45E4BB4149BB9B1DEEE15F54B8.description:
Students examine the scope of career opportunities in and the importance of
agriculture to the economy.

0186F352759740A2B08F2E169173E68A.description:
Assess the benefits, risks, and opportunities associated with using biotechnology
to promote animal health.

38425564B1F94665B9CF4F2F97B78CCA.description:
Research genetic engineering and CRISPR procedures used in production of
animal species.

A0B98919FDDE4CE1B7BAE31403999DE1.description: Assess and argue the pros and cons of transgenic species.

C89BE1A32FF54726BF8B00547E2C8578.description: Research and summarize public perceptions of biotechnology in agriculture.

58AF2603ACF340318B4BAC32B1833BD3.description:
Assess and summarize the role and scope of agencies that regulate
biotechnology.

9069B2DB6323454284253003B2342CF3.description:
Compare and contrast the benefits and risks of biotechnology compared with
alternative approaches to improving agriculture.

0EDFEB8EC5664948B7C200EA438B5D4C.description:
Distinguish between current and emerging applications of biotechnology in
agriculture.

0FE84040EF1E416A96C9EEA127860A36.description:
Assess and summarize current work in biotechnology being done to add value to
animal agriculture and society.

1C2BBA3F9F6B474AAD70BFDE5834A741.description: Research and summarize the evolution of biotechnology in animal agriculture.

A4F1DA43452A4B15AD534E722245F66E.description: Investigate and explain the roles and issues of biotechnology in animal agriculture.

21D497A5E1AE4B03894BDD163213237F.description:
Implement and evaluate the effectiveness of methods to ensure optimal
environmental conditions for animals.

12ABE00DE9C649DC95A9CA9A4F87C611.description:
Critique the reliability and validity of evidence presented to support claims
regarding the effects of environmental conditions on animal populations and
performance (e.g., population changes, emerging species, extinction, etc.).

9A62C7A42CBE40E5BA81CE6F24D34697.description:
Assess the effectiveness of methods of reducing the effects of animal agriculture
on the environment.

C4E3FD537392438F8204482A80888964.description:
Students design and evaluate environments for animals to promote animal health
and husbandry.

F0D53B446B95451980A9074E6E372624.description:
Analyze the health risk of different zoonotic diseases to humans and identify
prevention methods.

956303955BA944EC85E37C7C8FF64508.description:
Analyze procedures at the local, state and national levels to ensure biosecurity of
the animal industry.

1360C8676B744993AE85ED9C76883F57.description:
Assess the safety and effectiveness of facilities and equipment used for surgical
and nonsurgical veterinary treatments and procedures.

D1266A80ACCD41519A77FC6960917798.description:
Research and analyze data to evaluate preventive measures for controlling and
limiting the spread of diseases, parasites and disorders among animals.

8796FFA8D3BF41A48F23D457523F7AC1.description:
Identify and describe common illnesses and disorders of animals based on
symptoms and problems caused by wounds, diseases, parasites and
physiological disorders.

C282DBA82648466D8D97D23DF0AA1369.description:
Perform simple health-check evaluations on animals and practice basic
emergency response procedures related to animals.

33054153CBF2423188BEDD23829FA445.description:
Describe and demonstrate the proper use and function of specific tools and
technology related to animal health management.

DC9B55F2F3EE4996A6E492F10A4DBCFF.description:
Students design programs to prevent animal diseases, parasites and other disorders
and analyze biosecurity measures utilized to ensure animal welfare.

63DDBB9F25D34213A0F9E95E6DC62BFA.description: Evaluate and select products from animals based on industry standards.

BF5F70F4A3274862AD59E51916A88CF7.description:
Compare and contrast procedures to sustainably and efficiently develop an
animal to reach its highest performance potential with respect to its anatomical
and physiological characteristics.

F2ED499B688549F093EE2016CC8C66C4.description:
Compare and contrast desirable anatomical and physiological characteristics of
animals within and between species.

BAEF74F3024144BC948E3E3E0423347B.description:
Select and train animals for specific purposes and maximum performance based on
anatomy and physiology.

73731B74A08242BBB80894175D068452.description:
Compare and contrast animal cells, tissues, organs, body systems types and
functions among animal species.

FFE2036F7E394658A75E5137B78CC2EB.description:
Analyze the processes of meiosis and mitosis in animal growth, development,
health and reproduction.

3E4215E7EF0D44C7BB55DB7B8781E571.description: Analyze the functions of each animal cell structure.

7437CCD6A2D34F738105DA8F69640A03.description:
Apply principles of comparative anatomy and physiology to uses within various
animal systems.

23487C73E5A344E8BB6C05A030AE9D00.description:
Analyze the visual characteristics of an animal or animal product and select
correct classification terminology when referring to companion and production
animals.

DB0230920BAA40678F6F9E7C5E1F67A1.description:
Appraise and evaluate the economic value of animals for various applications in
the agriculture industry.

4B27CE5C609346D689ACDBA17877EAE9.description: Explain how animals are classified using a taxonomic classification system.

CC9D07B4854648728EACF7F63FC57B64.description:
Classify animals according to taxonomic classification systems and use (e.g.
agricultural, companion, etc.).

7124F4CA06D048B691E006CFC5D93692.description: Analyze the structure of laws pertaining to animal systems.

74A550A954DF423B80C2459DB2DFF6E3.description: Analyze animal facilities to determine if standards have been met.

B967B46B80984D8D9EA64A581E572FFC.description:
Analyze the use of modern equipment, technology and handling facility
procedures and determine if they enhance the safe, economic and sustainable
production of animals.

2233050501894F08B1F12FE0210D6D98.description:
Critique designs for an animal facility and prescribe alternative layouts and
adjustments for the safe, sustainable and efficient use of the facility.

7939C3934DA148BBAC12D388C287B9D6.description:
Design animal housing, equipment and handling facilities for the major systems of
animal production.

861C6D58B38A41B2A3C1303ECB0400D1.description:
Compare and contrast quantitative breeding value differences between
genetically superior animals and animals of average genetic value.

795C2930A64440F4A5FA377528DF8366.description:
Analyze the processes of major reproductive management practices, including
estrous synchronization, superovulation, flushing and embryo transfer.

6F74C891B5AE4E9D9A47857607A76EC5.description:
Develop an understanding of artificial insemination, embryo transfer, and
cloning.

23EE1C978CF44793822CF2392E24EEF1.description:
Calculate the potential economic benefits of natural versus artificial breeding
methods.

11BEE125AE0047D29C682F677EFEC001.description: Analyze the care needs for breeding stock in each stage of growth.

201620B9531547968E53E403CF9AF79F.description: Analyze how DNA analysis can detect genetic defects in breeding stock

BC23C9A64A8D48439B5E4F56558B9807.description: Demonstrate how to determine probability trait inheritance in animals.

62BD48F7530C44C69C4072D5A18CAD5E.description:
Compare and contrast the use of genetically superior animals in the production
of animals and animal products.

7BF2FEFE5DF64F599075AB394ED36C5E.description: Evaluate reproductive problems that occur in animals.

EE5551EBEBFA47FDBA98C0DC37DDDB39.description: Assess and describe factors that lead to reproductive maturity.

F340402431E842409804600AC762FADE.description:
Analyze the functions of major organs in the male and female reproductive
systems.

ACC912BB30334380BFAD3AB9425824E1.description:
Students evaluate animals for reproduction readiness and soundness and apply
scientific principles to breeding programs.

7D5D4C244A2C44C784B4093FEE0AC24B.description:
Analyze technologies used to provide animal nutrition and summarize their
potential benefits and consequences.

BDF77646A85E4A89B588782F8B7F3CEA.description:
Analyze and apply information from a feed label and feeding directions to feed
animals.

6752F572CAE8424C8AB8B0868283984C.description: Utilize tools and equipment to perform animal nutrition tasks.

E870494C1F4E45F19845EE79302A4AB1.description:
Compare and contrast methods that utilize feed additives and growth
promotants with production practices that do not, (e.g., organic versus
conventional production methods).

B8CFEDE317A0453788BB9AB4DE3275D6.description:
Appraise the adequacy of feed rations using data from the analysis of feedstuffs,
animal requirements and performance.

47C59302CF3E424D846D674E762641D9.description:
Determine the relative nutritional value of feedstuffs by evaluating their general
quality and condition.

8B85B05598A44A72AF5BE1B9FF5C746A.description: Correlate a species’ nutritional needs to feedstuffs that could meet those needs.

390C8585D59D400BA961394223869131.description:
Differentiate between nutritional requirements of animals in different growth
stages and production systems (e.g., growth, maintenance, gestation, natural,
organic, etc.).

91A8E688B09F46E5A10691E4A958663F.description:
Students analyze the nutritional needs of animals and evaluate feed rations for
effectiveness.

58245AD8BFAD40228527AFDC3D12E2DD.description:
Analyze and summarize the impact of animal trace-back capabilities on
producers and consumers.

1E1B14387F6F4578944B8061ADB01F7E.description:
Analyze consumer concerns with animal production practices relative to human
health.

9388124DFAD649608966C7B6FCB2D359.description:
Utilize tools, technology and equipment to perform animal husbandry and
welfare tasks.

7CABEB882597409DB5BFCF1808CFB4F9.description:
Analyze and document animal husbandry practices and their impact on animal
welfare.

C4A8E3ECE1BB4948BB4E747BEA84857A.description:
Analyze and document animal welfare procedures used to ensure safety and
maintain low stress when moving and restraining animals.

0FD7725AB0DC4787B7BD241136B9B0F0.description:
Design production plans that assure the welfare of animals and prevent abuse or
mistreatment

6CF198F5370D4F43B90048B6DFB5CAA5.description:
Students demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare and
analyze procedures to ensure animal safety while maintaining safe animal products.

3EA79EC2186A4FA28D8A8BA7634E5322.description:
Analyze the local and global impact of sustainable animal agriculture practices on
human and environmental systems.

7E33E91913FF4304AEEB9E81FB248DE2.description:
Analyze the structure of laws governing animal industries, international trade
and animal production policies.

04A23827774B4E4BA03E64BF78FFBEBD.description:
Analyze and evaluate the accuracy and effectiveness of records used in an
animal system business.

24756D92BAF64EC28396C3EA7381F089.description: Calculate costs of marketing versus predicted increases in sales

F33F7A0BD1B34F2FBB3134B74633E39D.description:
Analyze the impact of animal production methods on end product qualities (e.g.,
price, sustainability, marketing, labeling, animal welfare, etc.)

F5D9FFEEF8A54D41922A3B22711183BF.description:
Explain the role of animal agriculture within the food system in meeting food
and nutritional security.

35682C098EEE44FC8B77F01741EEBA02.description:
Describe the historical and scientific developments of different animal industries
and summarize the products, services and careers associated with each.

9670BF3832CA4E52B4940CD53C0D4BA6.description:
Evaluate and describe characteristics of animals that developed in response to
the animal’s environment and led to their domestication.

715D0A0FFAA64F25B4A333889201A08E.description:
Students evaluate the implications of animal origin and analyze common animal
production methods from both producer and global perspectives.

6CCC1849FF7545329B4D7D70BB25716B.description: Historic and Current Trends in the Animal Systems Industry
